titleproper.value: Guide to the Nancy S. Dickinson Research Notes  <lb/>  1983-1992  <lb/> <num>MS-3077</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-01-29T21:30:39</date>

abstract.value: This collection is comprised of the research notes of Nancy S. Dickinson, a research fellow at the Colonial Williamsburg Foundation from 1986-1987. The work was funded by a National Endowment for the Humanities grant for a larger project entitled "English Ceramics in America 1760-1860: Marketing, Prices, and Availability." Dickinson's research focused on the ceramics trade in New York during the late 18th and early 19th centuries.

p.value: The collection should be cited as: Nancy S. Dickinson Research Notes, MS 3077, The New-York Historical Society.

One of the important papers resulting from this research project was "Changing Consumption Patterns, English Ceramics and the American Market from 1770 to 1840" by George L. Miller, Ann Smart Martin and Nancy S. Dickinson.  It was published in the book <emph title="italic">Everyday Life in the Early Republic</emph>, edited by Catherine E. Hutchins for Winterthur Museum.
